DataElement.preferredDefinition: A free-text field to identify the specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: a unique identifier for the surgical pathology specimen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/7/16 unretired DEC, used in CDE with multiple context reuse.  11/20/11 Retired BCRv1.0 content as part of model cleanup task.  TCGA Model already retired. Updated to use OC Specimen with NCIt concept attached. DW 05-12-2015

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::40_An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases)._An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::40:An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 12/15/08 - released for use in C3D MGH Imaging trial.  7/08 - created to support ACRIN Breast CDEs
